activities.loc: Courtroom B, Third Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Winston Everret Tomlinson

Indigency hearing on November 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

No violent or disorderly conduct with victim: J.T. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint with GPS monitor.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Curfew from 6:00 AM - 6:00 PM unless driving to or from work.

2:40 PM Defendant Winston Everret Tomlinson appeared by phone.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant filed petition for court appointed attorney. Matter to be set for indigency hearing. Victim J.T. addresses court by video. Court grants Defendant's motion for bond modification and amends conditions to: No violent or disorderly conduct with victim: J.T. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint with GPS monitor.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Curfew from 6:00 AM - 6:00 PM unless driving to or from work. Defendant to sign bond 11/04/2022.

03:34 PM  Defendant Winston Everret Tomlinson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney C. James Fitzgerald appeared by video for Winston Everret Tomlinson.  Prosecuting attorney David S Olson and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address confirmed. $1000.00 signature bond set with conditions.  Adjourned initial appearance on October 26, 2022 at 1:00 pm.

No contact directly or indirectly with victim J.J.T., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint with GPS monitor.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Curfew from 6:00 AM - 6:00 PM unless driving to or from work.

03:04 PM Defendant Winston Everret Tomlinson appeared in custody by video. Attorney Longoria appearing by video  for attorney Michael Shannon Murphy.  Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant recalled. Matter continued at request of attorney Murphy.
Initial appearance scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
